com.samsung.android.sdk.remotesensor

Class Srs

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.remotesensor.Srs
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SsdkInterface

    public class Srs
extends Object
implements SsdkInterface
    This class is the entry class that provides access to the Remote Sensor package. This class provides methods for initializing the Remote Sensor package and for checking whether the Remote Sensor feature is supported.

      This constant is used to check whether Remote Sensor Service is supported or not.

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Context context)
                throws SsdkUnsupportedException
        Initialize an instance of the Remote Sensor package. This method must be called before the other Remote Sensor package methods.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface SsdkInterface
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application
        Throws:
        SsdkUnsupportedException - Thrown if the Remote Sensor is not supported on the device.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the Context passed is null

      • isFeatureEnabled

        public boolean isFeatureEnabled(int type)
        There are three types, TYPE_GEAR_MANAGER, TYPE_GEAR_FIT_MANAGER, TYPE_REMOTE_SENSOR_SERVICE. If this method returns false, a user has to download and install the appropriate application in the host device. That means, Gear Manager (or Gear Fit Manager) application and Remote sensor service. Note: Gear Manager (or Gear Fit Manager) should be installed before Remote sensor service installation. If the order is reversed, the remote sensor service may not work correctly.
        Specified by:
        isFeatureEnabled in interface SsdkInterface
        Parameters:
        type - The type indicating the features TYPE_GEAR_MANAGER, TYPE_GEAR_FIT_MANAGER, TYPE_REMOTE_SENSOR_SERVICE.
        Returns:
        True - if the feature is supported. false - if the feature is not supported.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the Srs.initialize is not called before this call.
